item.name: Ki-rin's Guidance
entries: The string is made from its hair, the riser is made from its carved horn, limbs made from its sculpted bones.

When you lunch an arrow from this weapon, the arrow transforms into a {@spell Guiding Bolt} of light. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} radiant damage, and all your subsequent attacks from this weapon ignores target's AC from dexterity modifier. On a critical success, further attacks automatically hit until either the target or you're unconscious.

item.name: Spirit String Bow
entries: When the string is pulled an ethereal arrow forms. The arrows are considered magical weapons in terms of resistance. You can fire twice every time you attack as you don't have to spend time to get an arrow from your quiver.

item.name: Razorwind
entries: Causes the air behind it to become as sharp as a blade. Arrows fired from this bow deal an extra {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and on a critical roll, causes the target to bleed for {@damage 1d4} damage per turn until it succeeds a DC equal to your Strength modifier +10 Constitution saving throw repeated at the end of its turn.

item.name: Rifling Bow
entries: The bow has protrusions on its arrow rest. When released, an arrow starts to spin fast. If you hit, creatures directly behind are hit, if your attack roll surpasses their AC, until a creature's AC from armor stops it.

item.name: Bastilla
entries: Using a bonus action, you can deploy the Bastilla's stand to gain +3 on your attack rolls. You can either deploy the Bastilla on a half cover sized object, or choose to go prone to deploy it on the ground. Retracting the stand also requires a bonus action. Attack rolls have -3 while moving with the stand out.

item.name: Rich Man's Crossbow
entries: This crossbow-like weapon uses pieces of currency as ammunition. The value of the coins themselves has an effect on the damage output as well. Coins fired this way are destroyed.
cp {@damage 1d10} piercing
sp {@damage 1d10} piercing (silvered)
gp {@damage 2d6} piercing + {@damage 1d4} radiant
ep {@damage 2d6} lightning + {@damage 1d6} piercing

item.name: Betrayer's Blade
entries: A small dagger with a jagged black blade. You have proficiency(expertise if you're already proficient) on any stealth/sleight of hand check to hide it, and get a surprise round when attacking any non-hostile character.

The location of this dagger is currently unknown, but it is being sought in connection with the murder of a Count. If you have any information regarding its whereabouts, report to your nearest guard post for a reward of 20 gold pieces.

item.name: Poisoner's Needle
entries: A dagger, has a hidden compartment in the handle, in which 4 doses of poison can be stored. A small button secretes poison on to the blade as an object action. Creature must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

item.name: Lightning Storm Gauntlet
entries: A gauntlet of black metal. Using a bonus action, you can charge the gauntlet with static electricity. When you hit with an unarmed attack you can cast {@spell Shocking Grasp}.

item.name: Giant Axe
entries: A ludicrously oversized and unwieldy axe. You get -5 on attack rolls. It ignores AC from shields. Minimum of 14 Strength is required to lift it. Roll and add another {@damage 1d20} damage if you roll a 20 on a damage roll. If your size is larger than medium, you only get -3 penalty.

item.name: Repulsor Gauntlet
entries: This gauntlet is made of various pieces of leather sown together with thick stitches with a large crystal disk fitted into the palm.

With this gauntlet, you can make a ranged spell attack against one creature you can see, within 10 feet of you. Although you are not proficient with it, you add your spellcasting modifier to attacks made with it. On a successful attack deal {@damage 1d6} thunder damage. Each time an attack is made with the Repulsor Gauntlet, increase the damage by an additional {@damage 1d6}. For example, if the Repulsor Gauntlet has been used 5 times, it will deal {@damage 6d6} damage.

If you roll 1 on the attack roll, the attack backfires and the wielder takes the damage instead. If you roll 2, the disc bolts out and you have to use an action to mount it back on. It resets after a backfire, a disc failure, a long rest or if you miss an attack. If you manage to kill a creature with this weapon, the creature explodes and the creature directly behind it takes the same damage from the weapon. On a critical hit target is pushed back 5 ft.

item.name: Morningstar of the Dawn
entries: Can cast Searing Smite a number of times equal to the wielder’s proficiency, recharges {@dice 1d4} per dawn.

item.name: The Great Annihilator's Fang
entries: A very large fang with a slight curve. In darkness, you can see shadows bend towards it.

You can use your bonus action to command it. It has a flying speed of up to 40 feet, but it can only travel in a straight line during a turn. It deals {@damage 1d4} force damage. You add your spellcasting modifier to both attack and damage rolls.

If you kill a creature with it, the creature turns into a shadow and absorbed by the fang. The fang then grants you an extra action which you have to use before you end your turn. If you try to throw it, it hangs in the air after leaving your hand.

entries.name: Curse
entries: It channels The Great Annihilator's shadow to you. The Great Annihilator comes to you in your dreams, both trying to consume you and trying to make you spread His shadows.

item.name: Chained Axe
entries: It is chained to your wrist and cannot be disarmed, but it takes an action to stow. Can cast Ensnaring Strike a number of times equal to your proficiency, with chains bursting from the ground to imprison your enemy. Recharges {@dice 1d6} per day.

item.name: Flashstep Rapier
entries: An elegant rapier, inlaid with elven engravings. Whenever you're about to make an attack, you can dash 5 feet towards your target to close the distance, as a free action. You have to make an attack roll with the rapier after dashing to be able to use it. To the untrained eye, it looks like you've teleported. If you are dashing away from another foe, you have +1 AC against opportunity attacks from that foe. Glows dimly when used and deals an extra {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.

item.name: Beacon Bow
entries: Shortbow, doing {@damage 1d6} radiant damage, and casting Light wherever its arrow lands. On a critical hit, It blinds its target for 1 round, if the target fails DC 10 Constitution saving throw.

Used by the legendary wood-elf, Aela the Drow-Hunter, in her quest into the Underdark to retrieve her kidnapped husband. Nock an arrow and its head will ignite with brilliant radiance. The creature can use its action to remove the arrow, or you may use a bonus action if you are within range. While the creature is under the magics effect, it cannot have any benefits from being invisible, hidden, or by being behind half cover.

item.name: Staff of Life
entries: As an action you may call upon the arcane power of this staff. In a flash of light, two lemons appear.

item.name: Hammer of the Farseer
entries: When you kill a monster with this weapon, you glimpse a random moment from its past. You may cast Augury once per day.

item.name: Grasping Whip
entries: When you hit with this weapon as a bonus action you can make a strength or dexterity contest to disarm or trip your enemy. You have disadvantage in this contest if disarming a two handed weapon or tripping a creature larger than yourself.
Take care picking it up or its lash will snap to your wrist.

item.name: Giant Bow
entries: You use your Strength modifier for calculating the damage instead of Dexterity for this weapon. While carrying this bow, your movement is reduced by 10ft and you have -5 penalty on Dexterity saving throws. This bow has 40 ft. effective range. If your size is at least large you're not subjected to the penalties

item.name: Kingsglaive
entries: Ranged attacks with this dagger grant you {@spell Misty Step} spell. You can use your object interaction to teleport to the location of your dagger. If you choose to teleport, you deal extra {@damage 1d4} lightning damage and acquire the dagger. If you kill an enemy with this weapon you gain {@spell Haste} spell.

item.name: Spiderbite Daggers
entries: These daggers are made using the harvested fangs of a large venomous spider. When you hit the same target on your turn with each dagger, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take an extra {@damage 2d4} poison damage and become poisoned until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Orcish Falx
entries: Does max damage against targets with under 11AC, or who are unarmored. Critical hits lop off limbs.

item.name: Angels Will
entries: This greatsword was forged from an angels left wing. Leaves a dim light where it cuts.

item.name: Repeating Crossbow
entries: A dwarven contraption that flings out bolts at a startling rate. It does {@damage 3d4} piercing damage and can attack twice per round. It costs 3 bolts per attack, and the crossbow has 12 bolts loaded. It costs an action and your movement to reload instead of having the loading quality.

item.name: Vampiric Trident
entries: Its tip is lined with teeth. When you hit a living creature with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to deal additional {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage, as the weapon bites into the target. You have to make a Charisma check against target's Charisma Saving Throw. After this, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to half of the extra damage dealt.

item.name: Clockwork Bow
entries: This longbow has an assortment of gears and pulleys attached to it. Near the handle of the bow, there is a scope and a dial. This dial has three settings, Small, Medium, and Large.

If you are a creature who's size is the one the dial is set to, you have automatic proficiency with the bow. Additionally, you can use the scope to perfect your aim and spend a bonus action lining up your shot. On the next attack with this bow, you can fire as if you had Sharpshooter feat including the optional penalty.
The bow can be folded up to be concealed as a bonus action, and you have proficiency (expertise if you're already proficient) on sleight of hand checks to hide the weapon when it is in this state.

item.name: Spiked Chain
entries: Weapon of the mighty goblin warlord Ulx. Two-handed, 15 feet reach, double. {@dmage 2d4} piercing damage. Once you hit a creature, you can grapple it with an athletics check. On a success you can pull the creature up to 15 feet

item.name: Double Knock Bow
entries: You can chose to fire two arrows simultaneously as if you were firing one, you fire with a -4 penalty but damage is calculated for the arrows separately (both hit or both miss). You can target 2 adjacent creatures or one creature for both arrows.

item.name: Inevitable Bow
entries: A nonmagical arrow or bolt fired from this magic weapon emits a fizzing red glow when it hits a creature. Only one creature can be so affected at a time. All your subsequent attacks from this weapon ignores target's AC from dexterity modifier. When you attack a creature with the Inevitable Bow and roll a 20 on the attack roll, further attacks automatically hit until either the target or you're unconscious.

item.name: Bow of the Nymph
entries: Magical short-bow. The bow does not require ammo. When the bow is drawn without ammo, a magical arrow appears knocked in the bow.

Anyone struck by the magical arrow becomes charmed with the first creature it sees after being struck (as charm person—the target must be a humanoid of Medium or smaller size, Wisdom DC 11 negates). The charm effects wear off after 1 minute. The magical arrow does not cause pain, and is invisible unless detected by the Wisdom Save. The arrow disappears after the effect ends. The bow has 1 charge and recovers {@dice 1d2-1} charges at the end of a long rest.

item.name: The Rainbow
entries: All arrows shot with this bow leave behind streak of 7-colored light. Which deals an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage. Once per day you can instead cause it to start raining as if a {@spell Control Weather} spell was cast

item.name: Wind Walkers Bow
entries: An ornate silver bow. The string appears to shimmer with a blue light when drawn. This bow has 3 charges. When an arrow is fired from the Wind Walker's Bow you can chose to expend a charge as a bonus action and teleport to where ever the arrow makes contact. Teleport does not provoke opportunity attacks. Regains {@damage 1d4-1} charges every sunrise.

item.name: Blade of Selves
entries: While holding this weapon, as a bonus action, you may cast the {@spell Mirror Image} spell. When you cast {@spell Mirror Image} this way, it creates five illusory duplicates. Once you have used this ability you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This weapon is cursed, and attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by the {@spell Remove Curse} spell or similar magic. When the {@spell Mirror Image} spell is cast from this item, roll a d20. On a 1, one of the illusory duplicates created is a full grown clone inhabited by an evil aligned soul, and tries to take your place.

item.name: Lady Luck
entries: A shortsword with a blade of silver that critically hits on a 1. You have a +3 bonus to your attack rolls while you have under 1/2 of your max HP. Those who wield this sword tend to discover a latent love for games of chance.

item.name: Ice Sickle
entries: {@damage 1d4} slashing and {@damage 1d4} cold damage. On a hit a target must succeed DC 10 Constitution to be able to use its reaction until the start of their turn. Its blade is a translucent shard of ice, and its handle is bone.

item.name: David’s Sling
entries: +100 damage on a hit against any creature larger than you, 5 non-replenishing charges

item.name: The Judge
entries: Hits from this weapon cast {@spell Sacred Flame} upon the hit enemy. If you roll a 1 on an attack roll Vicious Mockery is cast on you.

item.name: Half-forged Longsword
entries: In an attempt to create a sentient Longsword. A powerful wizard and a renowned blacksmith got together. While being forged it kept yelling "Harder!", "Right there!", and other kinky stuff. The blacksmith couldn't handle hearing it every time he hammered the sword and gave up. Deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning + {@damage 1d4} psychic damage. If you can please it enough it has +1 magic for a day hours.

item.name: Akkadian Warhammer
entries: Blessed by Enlil. This weapon carries his perseverance. You can activate it using your bonus action. While you are holding it with two hands, next time you miss, {@spell Erupting Earth} spell is cast at the point of the target you were trying to hit. It has 10 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d4} charges at dawn.

item.name: Everglacier's Cold Fury
entries: This cold steel weapon from the Everglacier is topped with a menacing ice spike that never melts.

When you hit with an attack using this pike, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} cold damage. The weapon and its properties treat immunity to cold damage as resistance, and ignore resistance to cold damage.

When you reduce a Large or smaller creature to 0 hit points using this weapon, you can choose to encase that creature in ice. An encased creature is prevented from falling prone and is held in place by a shell of ice for 1 minute. If the creature is unconscious, it does not make death saving throws while it's encased in the ice. The ice has AC 12, 20 hit points, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and vulnerability to fire and thunder damage. If the encased creature is healed or the ice is destroyed, the ice crumbles and releases the reatures.

Chillspike: As an action you can plunge the pike into the ground at your feet. When you do, the blade of the pike magically vanishes into the earth and summons up to three icy spikes from the ground nearby. Choose up to 3 different targets on the ground you can see within 20 feet of you. An affected target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} cold damage as an frozen spike erupts from the ground beneath them. Immediately after using this property, the spikes recede into the ground, and the icy blade of the pike reappears.
It has 2 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d2-1} charges every day.

item.name: Achille's Spear
entries: A legendary +5/+5 spear. Critical hits against you however force a Constitution save, with a DC of the damage taken. Failure on this save reduces you to 0hp. Fatal damage still kills you. With a shaft hewn from the wood of an ancient tree at the foot of Mount Celestia, and a head said to be forged by Hephaestus himself, this is a weapon for victorious heroes - and yet it has been responsible for as many terrible defeats.

item.name: Crystal-heart Spear
entries: Its iron was mined from the Shale Cavern of Dolhiem. When the miner's couldn't separate the block of steel from the diamond, they forged around it.

When you hit, you can use a bonus action turn the spear's handle to shatter the diamond. Each turn, you can use your bonus action to draw energy from the splinters left inside the creature. On a failed DC 20 Constitution saving throw, the creature has 3 levels of exhaustion until the end of your next turn. You can repeat this until the splinters are removed from the creature somehow.
Once shattered, the diamond is no more. You can replace the diamond with a new one but the gem must be crafted into the spear.

item.name: Cu Chulainn's Spear
entries: A blood-red spear with relieves on it. Once a day you can infuse yourself with the speed and agility of Cu Chulainn and get a double action surge, meaning; you take two extra actions on your turn. You have to use all three actions to attack.
With this weapon, you add both your Dexterity and Strength modifiers to both your attack and damage rolls. Prerequisite: Dexterity 18, Strength 14

item.name: Mage Guardian's Greatsword
entries: Only the one who knows the ways of Mage Guardian can wield this sword.

This weapon absorbs the spells around. Whenever someone casts a harmful spell in 30 feet of you, it copies the damage type of the spell. When you hit, roll the dice for the damage again as the damage type it copied.

You can use your reaction to make an attack roll against any harmful spell that targets only you to block the spell entirely. You must roll higher than the attacker's roll or DC, plus the level of the spell.
Prerequisite: Strength 18, Intelligence 14.

item.name: Ghost Mail
entries: Scale mail that allows you to use a reaction to have a melee attack pass through you, as if you were ethereal. Each use pulls you towards death, and next time you must make death saves you automatically fail one for each use of this item. If you survive, this is reset. Would likely only be used to avoid fatal damage. When the light shines just right on this armor's polished scales, tendrils of white mist can be discerned moving somewhere within.

item.name: Scorpion Armor
entries: Crafted from the chitin of a giant scorpion. Your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22. When you take a critical hit, your blood splatters and deals the damage you took as acid damage to all enemies adjacent to you.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Once you wear this armor, you are cursed. It corrupts your blood with venom of the scorpion. Dark green veins show under your skin. Your maximum hit points are reduced by a number equal to your level + your class hit die and healing potions deal damage to you. You can instead drink poison potions to recover. Your AC is 15 + your Dexterity modifier (max 2).

item.name: Venombane Armor
entries: This spider hide armor absorbs poison and allows you to traverse webbed areas more easily. While you're wearing this armor, you can't be caught in webs of any sort and can move through webs as if they were difficult terrain. In addition, when you take poison damage while wearing this armor, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by {@dice 1d8} + your Constitution modifier.

item.name: Darkwood Half Plate Armor
entries: This armor is made of darkwood, a light but dense wood that is as strong as steel and cannot catch fire. This armor weighs half as much as its mundane equivalent. You don't have disadvantage with Dexterity (Stealth) checks wearing this armor.

item.name: Darkwood Breastplate Armor
entries: This armor is made of darkwood, a light but dense wood that is as strong as steel and cannot catch fire. This armor weighs half as much as its mundane equivalent. Your AC equals to 14 + your Dexterity modifier.

item.name: Elven Chain
entries: Pinnacle of elven craftsmanship. You are considered proficient with this armor, even if you lack proficiency with medium armor. Your AC equals to 13 + your Dexterity modifier. This armor is concealed.

item.name: Ravenous Sentinel
entries: When an incoming attack misses by between 1 to 4 points, tries to “eat” the metal weapon with an opposed attack roll (magic weapons add their enhancement bonus squared). If it succeeds, the weapon is destroyed and the armor gains +3 magic bonus for 1 minute. The armor must be “fed” daily or else it may try to eat nearby metal objects at random.

item.name: Armor of the Totem
entries: This suit of studded leather armor is made entirely without metal. Studs are made of polished ironwood. Buckles and clasps are crafted of carved bone, horn, and claw. When you use your Wild Shape ability, this armor changes shape as well, granting +2 AC while in animal form. Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

item.name: Juggernaut Plate
entries: Requires str 18, max speed 30ft, gives -5 to Dexterity saves while wearing, but allows a special attack action.

Charge: move 30 ft straight and make a Shove contest against all in the path of the last 20ft, doing {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning to all who fail. You do not provoke attack of opportunity, and moving through enemy space is treated as normal terrain. You have resistance to mundane damage until the end of your next turn after Charge is initiated.
You have +5 to Athletics checks when charging.

item.name: Tabula Rasa
entries: A clean, white, adamantine plate armor. When you kill an elemental, a rune engraving related to the type of the elemental appears on the armor, giving you permanent resistance to the type of the elemental while you're donned.

item.name: Mithril Plate Armor
entries: Mithril is a light, flexible metal. Mithril armor weighs half as much as its mundane equivalent. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks or has a Strength requirement, the mithril version of the armor doesn't.

item.name: Mithril Splint Armor
entries: Mithril is a light, flexible metal. Mithril armor weighs half as much as its mundane equivalent. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks or has a Strength requirement, the mithril version of the armor doesn't.

item.name: Symbiotic Armor
entries: In its true form it's a black goo. You can make it look like common clothes at will while you're out of combat. Mechanics wise you are considered unarmored. Your AC is 8 + your Dexterity(+ Constitution modifier if you're a Barbarian and + Wisdom modifier if you're a Monk) modifier. You gain +2 to Dexterity, Strength, and Constitution and your Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution maximums are increased by 2. You have -4 Wisdom and your Wisdom maximum is decreased by 2. You have Proficiency(Expertise if you're already proficient) in Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution Saving Throws. You cannot Doff this armor. It is a part of you and it feeds of off you. You are unable to gain temporary hit points no matter what and healing effects on you are halved. You have double the maximum hit dice you normally have. As an action, you can expend a hit die to recover hit points. Creatures don't gain advantage while flanking you. You have two reactions instead of one. In combat you refer to yourself in a plural manner. Kills grant you temporary hit points equal to your level. You have vulnerability to force and thunder damage.

item.name: Mirage Shield
entries: This is a shield that casts Shield on you. It has a rune engraved under its grip. When you follow the engraving with your finger using a bonus action, it lights up dimly and activates. Next time you are attacked light refracts from the shield and another shield appears in front of this shield. It has 1 charge which replenishes after a short rest.

item.name: Band of the Shimmering Shield
entries: A brass arm band that projects a disk of force, giving +2AC, but leaving your hand free enough to still take the 'use an object' action.

item.name: Eladrian Shield
entries: A wooden shield inlaid with mithril ornaments. Slightly pulls any projectile towards it. Provides +3 AC against projectiles and +2 AC to the rest of the attacks.

item.name: Twitcher's Shield
entries: This shield feeds from your fears. Whenever you're surprised you panic and rise you shield gaining temporary hit points equal to 20 - your Wisdom until the end of the surprise round.

item.name: Sage Bull
entries: A full metal shield with a large bull face ornament at the front.
This shield holds a maximum of 5 charges. It replenishes {@dice 1d4} charge every dawn.
Guiding Flame: You may expend 2 charges to have the guiding flame show you the level of danger in the direction you're pointing it at.
-Green Flame - No Threat
-Purple Flame - Low Threat
-Red Flame - Medium Threat
-Black Flame - High Threat.

entries.name: In Flames
entries: When melee attacked, as a reaction, you may expend 2 charges to attempt to ignite the attacking creature in flames. Attacking creature must make a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw. If they fail, they take {@damage 3d10} fire damage. If they are successful, nothing happens.

item.name: Mirrored Shield
entries: You can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a projectile like spell that targets only you. If the attacker's roll equals your AC or spell's DC equals your Dexterity saving throw, it reflects the spell back at its caster.

item.name: Coralshield Golem
entries: This ancient golem is fashioned in the shape of a crab and made of a light but sturdy coral. While wearing it on your back, you can use a bonus action to instruct it to shield you. Doing so causes the crab to slowly move along your arm, and at the start of your next turn dons itself like an ordinary shield. Once equipped, you can instruct it to return to your back, doffing itself at the start of your next turn.

If you do not have a free hand or refuse to drop what you're holding when the crab attempts to don itself, it returns and reattaches to your back at the start of the next turn, when it can be summoned once again. If the golem is removed from you against your will, it will slowly move toward you at a speed of 5 feet as it can see you.

item.name: Rho Aias
entries: This shield expands and gives bonus equal to the number of enemies in 30 feet of you to your AC, starting from +0. For each expansion you get -5 ft. to your speed.

item.name: Injection Arrow
entries: These arrow's heads are hollow and have storage equal to that of a vial. It contains a tiny mechanism similar to a syringe. You can use an action to prepare a syringe. Liquids held within never dry out, and are injected directly into a creature struck.

item.name: Armor Piercing Arrow
entries: These arrows have very narrow metal tips, instead of a standard broad head, they appear much as a target arrow, but painfully sharp and heavier. Because of the small point of impact, the armor-piercing arrow can penetrate better through most armors. Wielding an armor-piercing arrow ignores up to 3 points of creature's AC gained from mundane armor.

item.name: Arrows of Transposition
entries: On-hit, the attacker and target immediately exchange positions, if they both can fit. If a transposition is impossible, both take {@damage 3d6} force damage, and are returned to their original positions.

item.name: Hollow-point Arrows
entries: On-hit, the target must make a DC equal to your Strength modifier + 10 Strength save or be knocked prone. Damage dealt is Bludgeoning, rather than Piercing.

item.name: Arrow of Rest
entries: if it hits on a surprise round it casts Sleep on that target.

item.name: Horned Arrow
entries: Forged from the horns of  slaughtered unicorns, each horned arrow is sentient with soul of the unicorn it was crafted from. They remember how they died and how they were forged into the arrow. Over a long time, they are broken into Stockholm Syndrome. As a bonus action, you may magically call all horned arrows back to you. An arcane unicorn embodies each arrow and they run back into your quiver. You gain +2 to your attack and damage rolls made with this arrow. These arrows cannot break as long as you are attuned to them.

item.name: Ring?
entries: This ring has {@spell Nondetection} spell cast on it by itself continuously.

item.name: Ring of Mind Shielding
entries: You are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it. You can use an action to cause the ring to become invisible until you use another action to make it visible, until you remove the ring, or until you die. If you die while wearing the ring, your soul enters it, unless it already houses a soul. You can remain in the ring or depart for the afterlife. As long as your soul is in the ring, you can telepathically communicate with any creature wearing it. A wearer can't prevent this telepathic communication.

item.name: Ring of Shark Detection
entries: Plays the Jaws music when a shark is within 60ft.

item.name: Ring of Water Walking
entries: You can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground.

item.name: Exile's Ring
entries: An exotic ring with tiny chains circling it.

entries.name: Curse
entries: It's cursed and cannot be removed. Once worn, whatever settlement you're in, you are magically exiled {@dice 1d6} days after from there. Reroll the die when you enter an another settlement. You roll Wisdom Saving Throw with DC 10 to enter or stay in a settlement you're exiled. The DC increases each day by 1. Once a day you can cast 4th-level Banishment.

item.name: Ring of Entropy
entries: When you roll a critical fail, your next roll is critical success, vice versa. The second critical success/fail generated by the ring doesn't charge the ring again.

item.name: Heart of Hydra
entries: A red gold ring. Protects you from a fatal blow once, then shatters.

item.name: Seal of Gal'badur
entries: You can activate the ring to gain advantage on Charisma checks against dwarfs.

item.name: Ring of Alucard
entries: Whenever you deal melee damage to anything that isn't undead or a construct, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

item.name: Bands of Atonement
entries: Two interlocking bands, one gold engraved with a motifs of Justitia and the other granite with a motifs of Arete.
Justitia rewards order with temporary hit points equal to your level and punishes chaos with Shocking Grasp.
Arete rewards goodness with inspiration and punishes evil with a Sacred Flame.

item.name: Eyes of Minute Seeing
entries: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you can see much better than normal out to a range of 1 foot. You have proficiency(expertise if you're already proficient) on intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on sight while searching an area or studying an object within that range.

item.name: Mask of Confidence
entries: An ornate mask, like those worn for masked balls. The wearer hears a constant stream of sycophantic praise. Allows you to cast {@spell Charm} spell once a day.

item.name: Dancing Shoes
entries: When an attack misses you, you may move 5ft as a reaction. If you chose to move "U can't touch this" starts to play.
Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.

item.name: Achilles' Heal
entries: These boots have 3 charges which refreshes at dawn.
When you use any type of healing that requires die roll, you can expend a charge and reroll a die once.

item.name: Bands of Atonement
entries: Two interlocking bands, one gold engraved with a motifs of Justitia and the other granite with a motifs of Arete.
Justitia rewards order with temporary hit points equal to your level and punishes chaos with Shocking Grasp.
Arete rewards goodness with inspiration and punishes evil with a Sacred Flame.

item.name: Babel’s Ornament
entries: An earring that translates all languages, but sometimes lies and causes mischief.

item.name: Belt of the Last Man
entries: Gain +1 AC for each PC party member that is unconscious, with the effect ending if they die or wake up.

item.name: Cloak of the Matador
entries: As a reaction you may have an enemy attack against an ally within 5ft of you target you instead, if you took the dodge action on your turn - possibly causing it to miss.

item.name: Mantle of Misfortune
entries: When you roll 1 on a {@dice d20}, your mantle spreads the effect. Until the start of your next turn, any creature within 60 feet must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result from any attack rolls, ability checks or saving throws.

item.name: Eldritch Scarf
entries: This dark, silky scarf moves slightly on its own in a breeze that no one can feel and absorb more light than it reflects.

The scarf has an extradimensional space within the folds of its fabric that can only be reached while it's worn. The space holds 60 pounds of material, not exceeding a volume of 6 cubic feet. The scarf always weighs 1 pound, regardless of its contents.

Despite being able to place items in the scarf, reaching back into it fails to return them to your grasp. The frayed ends of the scarf are actually wisp-like hands that slowly twist and curl on their own. While wearing the scarf, you can mentally command the hands as a bonus action to reach into the extradimensional space and retrieve a stored item.
Placing the scarf inside an extradimensional space created by a "bag of holding", "portable hole", or similar item instantly destroys both items and creates a singularity.

item.name: Belt of Returning
entries: A finely crafted dark leather belt with three loops, each decorated with a shard of sapphire.

The magic of the belt leaves an invisible mark on the surface of the weapons stowed in each loop and invisibly inscribes the name of the item on the sapphire shard. Three one-handed weapons with the thrown property can be 'attuned' to the belt.
When a weapon, from the belt, is thrown at an object or creature, hit or miss, the weapon will return to the belt at the end of your turn.

item.name: Eye of the Fiendlord
entries: While you are attuned to the eye, once a day, you can cast see invisibility on yourself at will. You can choose to see through its magically enhanced lens using a bonus action.
Looking through the eye grants you darkvision of up to 120 feet, and are able to peer through both magical and nonmagical darkness using it.

entries.name: Curse
entries: When you attune to the Eye of the Fiendlord, you are suddenly overcome with the urge to see what it sees. Make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, you're able to resist the enchantment and are aware of the curse's effects, but are not attuned to it. On a failure, you forcefully tear out one of your own eyes, taking {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage, allowing the Eye of the Fiendlord to crawl into its place. If you are already missing an eye, you are simply compelled to allow the eye to crawl into the empty socket.

You can see normally while the Eye of the Fiendlord remains in your socket, but you can choose to close your other eye to see through its magically enhanced lens using a bonus action. The eye moves slower than a normal eye, leaving slight trails and motion blurs behind it as you look through it. While looking only through the Eye of the Fiendlord, you have disadvantage on any attack you make as well as ability checks that rely on depth perception. You can open your other eye and regain your normal vision using another bonus action.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The eye is a gruesome familiar. As an action, you can command the eye to crawl out of its socket and move independently of you. Use the abilities described in the {@spell Find Familiar} spell when commanding the Eye of the Fiendlord. The eye has five hit points, an AC of 12, movement and climbing speed of 20 feet, does not require air to breathe, and has a +6 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks. If the eye is slain or you dismiss it, it reappears inside your open eye socket with a sickly sound. If it was slain, you cannot use its magical sight or command it as a familiar again until the following dusk.

Targeting the eye with the {@spell Remove Curse} spell or unattuning to it causes the eye to pull itself out of the socket and crawl away. Slaying the eye while it is unattuned to a creature destroys the item.

item.name: Red Claw's Regalia
entries: This tough dragon scale robe is miraculously insulated and comfortable. While wearing the robe, you gain the following benefits:
-You can withstand extreme temperatures without any additional protection.
-Your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22.
-You have resistance to fire damage.
-You can walk on lava as if it were solid ground, without taking fire damage from it. Ending your turn on lava causes you to sink into it and take fire damage as normal.

The hem of this robe glimmers with slowly shifting embers. While wearing this robe, your steps leave behind small motes of magical fire and scorched earth. The flames and marks left behind are harmless and disappear 1 second after they appear.

item.name: Wrath of Zeus
entries: Gold plate bracers. Your unarmed critical strikes explode with {@spell Thunderclap}, unless you critically miss in which case it backfires and you take {@damage 1d6} thunder damage. Spells DC equals to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Charisma modifier.

item.name: Mage Guardian's Helm
entries: A full plate helmet without any openings. While you are wearing it, you are blinded, deafened, and mute. If you know the ways of Mage Guardian, you can activate the helm's 60-foot Truesight. Provides resistance to psychic damage, {@spell Charm} and {@spell Sleep}.

item.name: Webgrip Rucksack
entries: This spider leather bag is lined with a thin layer of adhesive web.

Items stored inside the bag are held in place by the web, preventing stored items from clattering around or being removed without permission. While you're wearing the bag, creatures other than you have disadvantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks to steal from the bag. The bag and its eight straps adhere to the surface they're pressed against, such as a creature's torso or the wall of an inn. If you're wearing the bag, you can gently remove the straps from your body as an action. Other creatures that attempt to wrench the bag from you make any Strength checks to do so with disadvantage.

The bag can hold up to 8 cubic feet or 80 pounds. Spider leather is pliable and stretches easily, allowing the bag to shrink and grow to accommodate the objects placed inside to some degree. Even though the eyes adorning the bag are lifeless and unmoving. they still blink on rare occasion.

item.name: Swiss Army Wand
entries: You're not sure who the Swiss are or why an army would need such a non-aggressive wand, but it seems useful enough. Never Leave Home Without It. This wand regains {@dice 1d6+1} expended charges daily at dawn. You can expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells from the wand: {@spell Create Bonfire} (1 charge), {@spell Dancing Lights} (1 charge), {@spell Mending} (1 charge), {@spell Prestidigitation} (1 charge), or {@spell @spell Alarm} (2 charges).

item.name: Wand of Magic Missiles
entries: While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell Magic Missile} spell from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend. The wand regains {dice 1d6+1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Clockwork Faefly
entries: This bronze clockwork mechanism is 2 inches long and has a glass vial under it. It whirs with the hum of tiny gears inside.
You can tap the head of the faefly twice as a bonus action. When you do, the mechanism flutters 5 feet in the air and emits the {@spell light} spell.

The faefly has AC 15 and 10 hit points and flies in this way until it falls to 0 hit points or another creature grasps it. If you move more than 3 feet from the hovering faefly, it follows you until it is within 3 feet of you.
If the {@spell Mending} spell is cast on the faefly while it has at least 1 hit point, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. If the faefly drops to 0 hit points, it can't be used again.

item.name: Clockwork Healerbee
entries: This pill-shaped magical mechanism is 2 inches long and made of brass. It has a pair of tiny wings that silently keep it aloft. It hovers up to 5 feet above the ground and does its best to stay at your side within your space.

The bee has 8 charges and regains {@dice 1d6+2} expended charges daily at dawn. While the bee is within your space, you can speak its command word and expend up to 3 of its charges as a bonus action to command the bee to heal a creature that you can see within 20 feet of you. The bee flies to the creature's space and stings the creature, casting a {@spell Healing Word} for each expended charge. After healing the creature, the bee returns to your space.

It has AC 15, 10 hit points, and has resistance to all damage types. If the {@spell Mending} spell is cast on the bee while it has at least 1 hit point, it regains 2d6 hit points. If the bee drops to 0 hit points, it can't be used again.

item.name: All-In Coin
entries: On a roll you would normally use a {@dice d20}, flip a coin instead. Heads is a critical success, tails is a critical fail. It has one charge and refills when you roll 20 or 1 naturally.
